user_input: Use the Joule plexos Model. Use the split operation to divide Nuclear generators in france into 2 objects one in north one in south keep the object name length to 4 characters
author: Assistant
default_llm_context: Perform the specified operation in the Joule Model using the PLEXOS CRUD pipeline. Split Nuclear generator objects in France into two per original (North and South).

tasks.description: Split all Nuclear generators in France into two generator objects per original—one for North and one for South
tasks.entity_selection_context: Model: Joule Model. Entity type: Generator objects. Selection filter: Fuel/technology = Nuclear; geographic scope = France. Operation: For each selected source object, create two destination objects representing North and South. Naming rule: derive a base from the source object name by taking its first 3 characters (if longer than 3) and append 'N' for North and 'S' for South, producing names of length ≤ 4. Enforce uniqueness within the Generator class; if a collision occurs, resolve deterministically while maintaining a maximum of 4 characters and preserving the 'N'/'S' suffix. Preserve existing properties, attributes, and memberships from the source to both destinations.
